conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the acceleration-time graph to determine the speed of the elevator at t = 60 seconds using the area under the acceleration curve.
The image shows an acceleration-time graph with trapezoidal segments: acceleration from 0 to 2 m/s² over 5 seconds, constant acceleration of 2 m/s² for 55 seconds, then a decrease.
Identify acceleration periods: 0-5 seconds (increase from 0 to 2 m/s²), 5-60 seconds (constant at 2 m/s²), 60-60 seconds (decrease).
Calculate velocity at t = 60 seconds using area under the curve: first segment area is 5 m/s.
Calculate second segment area: 2 m/s² for 55 seconds gives 110 m/s.
Total velocity change is 115 m/s by summing areas: 5 + 110.
Determine speed at t = 60 seconds: initial velocity is 0 m/s, so velocity is 115 m/s.
Speed at t = 60 seconds is the magnitude of velocity, which is 115 m/s.
